com.gemalto.idp.mobile.authentication.mode.biofingerprint

Interface BioFingerprintAuthenticationCallbacks


  • public interface BioFingerprintAuthenticationCallbacks
    This interface gives to an application maker a capability of following fingerprint authentication process and report a user regarding the progress.
    Since:
    4.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onAuthenticationError(int errorCode, java.lang.CharSequence errString)
      This callback function is called if fingerprint authentication failed with an unrecoverable error but was completed.
      void onAuthenticationFailed()
      This callback function is called if fingerprint was read but could not be recognized (for example, wrong finger was put on a sensor).
      void onAuthenticationHelp(int helpCode, java.lang.CharSequence helpString)
      This callback function is called if a recoverable error occured during authentication.
      void onAuthenticationSucceeded()
      This callback function is called if authentication with a fingerprint against enrolled fingerprints was successful - a fingerprint was recognized.
      void onError(IdpException e)
      This callback function is called if the fingerprint is not correctly configured or an internal cryptographic error occurs.
      void onStartFPSensor()
      This callback function is called when the Fingerprint sensor has started listening.
      void onSuccess(BioFingerprintAuthInput bioFPAuthInput)
      This callback function is called if: a user succeeded to authenticate using his fingerprint an object that represents a biofingerprint data used for OTP computation was initialized successfully Now user could use the authenticated bioFingerprint Authentication Input.

    • Method Detail

      • onSuccess

        void onSuccess(BioFingerprintAuthInput bioFPAuthInput)
        This callback function is called if:
        • a user succeeded to authenticate using his fingerprint
        • an object that represents a biofingerprint data used for OTP computation was initialized successfully
        Now user could use the authenticated bioFingerprint Authentication Input. eg. for OTP computation.
        Parameters:
        bioFPAuthInput - represents the authenticated biofingerprint authentication input object.

      • onStartFPSensor

        void onStartFPSensor()
        This callback function is called when the Fingerprint sensor has started listening.

        In this callback, application developer shall instruct the user to authenticate with fingerprint. eg. a DialogFragment with message displayed.

      • onError

        void onError(IdpException e)
        This callback function is called if the fingerprint is not correctly configured or an internal cryptographic error occurs.
        Parameters:
        e - exception object indicating fingerprint authentication problem. An application behavior can be determined according to an exception type.

      • onAuthenticationError

        void onAuthenticationError(int errorCode,
                           java.lang.CharSequence errString)
        This callback function is called if fingerprint authentication failed with an unrecoverable error but was completed. eg. If the user has tried with an invalid fingerprint consecutively. For the list of error codes and descriptions, please, turn to:
        Parameters:
        errorCode - a code of error that operation failed with
        errString - the description of error operation failed with.
        See Also:
        Section 'Constants' Please note that when under the condition where user has reached the maximum number of failed attempts permitted by the system (eg. 5 failed attempts), the sensor can be locked out for about 30 Seconds depends on the OS version and manufacturer.

      • onAuthenticationHelp

        void onAuthenticationHelp(int helpCode,
                          java.lang.CharSequence helpString)
        This callback function is called if a recoverable error occured during authentication. An error could be presented to user using dialog fragment. It gives to a user a chance of reauthenticating. For example: a finger was removed from a sensor too quickly. For the list of error codes and descriptions, please, turn to:
        Parameters:
        helpCode - code of message
        helpString - help string
        See Also:
        Section 'Constants'

      • onAuthenticationSucceeded

        void onAuthenticationSucceeded()
        This callback function is called if authentication with a fingerprint against enrolled fingerprints was successful - a fingerprint was recognized.

      • onAuthenticationFailed

        void onAuthenticationFailed()
        This callback function is called if fingerprint was read but could not be recognized (for example, wrong finger was put on a sensor). In such case an error can be presented to a user through dialog fragment.
